Package nl.nikhef.jgridstart.gui

Graphical user-interface

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ActionAbout Show "About" dialog
ActionChangeBrowser Pops up a dialog for selecting the certificate's preferred web browser.
ActionExport Export selected certificate to PKCS#12/PEM file
ActionImport Import a new certificate from a PKCS#12/PEM file
ActionInstall Install certificate into web browser.
ActionMakeDefault Make selected certificate the default.
ActionOpenURL Open an external web page showing help
ActionQuit Quit the application
ActionRefresh Refresh certificate information
ActionRenew Renew a certificate
ActionRequest Open the "request a new certificate" wizard
ActionRevoke  
ActionSelectCertificate Set the currently selected certificate
ActionShowDetails Toggle extended details pane
ActionViewCertificateList Set visibility of the certificate list
ActionViewLog Show log window
ActionViewRequest Show the request wizard for an existing certificate.
ActionViewVerificationForm Open verification form dialog.
ActionViewVerificationForm.CloseAction Action for closing the form window
ActionViewVerificationForm.PrintAction Action for printing the page displayed
ActionViewVerificationForm.SaveToPDFAction Action for saving the page displayed to a PDF
ActionViewVerificationForm.VerificationDialog Dialog that shows the verification form
CertificateAction Default implementation for Actions that operate on a CertificatePair.
ComponentCertificateList List of certificates.
JGSFrame Main jGridstart application window
Main Graphical user-interface main program
RequestWizard Wizard that asks the user for information and generates the certificate.
 

Package nl.nikhef.jgridstart.gui Description

Graphical user-interface

The Main program creates the main window JGSFrame, containing a ComponentCertificateList showing the available certificates, and a TemplatePanel with certificate details; the latter contains one of the html files present in this package.

Menu and shortcuts are populated by children of Actions. Some of these work on the currently selected certificate (which is kept track of by CertificateSelection), and these actions are children of CertificateAction.
